comments.commentBody: well, sniff!

Don't underestimate Trump. Others have made that mistake, and where are they now? Just whining and trying to undermine his administration, but aside from being disruptive and annoying, accomplishing nothing...
FACTS not fiction please. Obama , through quiet diplomacy has kept the Americans safer  than we has been for some years.....

Given Trumps gibberish filled nonsensical rant against Obama at 0502 this morning I suspect that he most definitely does not have "the intelligence to deal with this situation".  Emotional immaturity like this will only embolden Kim Jong-Un to launch against the USA as soon as it is feasible.
Yes.....quiet diplomacy was President Obama's greatest legacy to this country.....

Dealing with N. Korea requires cooperation from China & Russia. We cannot afford unilateral action towards N. Korea. On the other hand, putting a SAAD missile system in S. Korea in the name of detecting & shooting down N. Korea missile launch is really harmful & not helpful to China & Russia.  Just like Cuban crisis during Kennedy presidency when Russia wanted to put missiles in Cuba.  It also increases mis-trust for US-China & US-Russia relationship.

Ok, but just remember to take a look at history first. Back in the Korean War (which is technically in ongoing ceasefire), China was entirely undeveloped, barely recovered at all from the horrors of WW2. Russia gave NK and China everything they needed--training, weapons, combat pilots--to keep that war going. They kept it going in Vietnam, too, and many other hot proxy fights. Russia is not some big, harmless other somewhere in the world. They've been our main adversary for decades and have assisted in the deaths of tens of thousands of American soldiers along the way.
And he did this all by calm ,calculated diplomacy....not chest thumping & idiotic tweets!

Brilliant thinking! How about some Peter Pan peanut butter and loaves of multigrain, as well... Oh, and let's not forget rose petals. Lots and lots of rose petals. And maybe just a gentle sprinkling of pixie dust. That ought to prove to them that they do are not the only inhabitants of the loonyverse...

Wasn't there some piece of paper cast aside by another rRepublican president that lost the popular vote but thought he had a "mandate"?
"Bin Laden determined to attack US" I think was the title...

Right now Trump is way to busy in attempting to deflect Russiaghazi and in convincing us, well, the majority of us, that Mr. Obama tapped his phones, and last but not least, he needs to plan his next $3M golf outing at our expense.
Mr. Trump apparently has little need for the daily briefings and has stated he knows more than the generals.
Well, time will tell, in hopes we will be around to see, if his planning and execution skills are the best and most bigly amongst the Presidents he succeeded.
Who is the "virulent infant" to whom you refer?  Kim is looking pretty coolheaded.  But only relatively.

The headline in The Times this morning,  'Cyberwarfare against North Korea'  undoubtedly should have wobbled the pedestal Trump has perched himself upon, a pedestal by the way surrounded by water way over his head, instead, he spent the morning false-Tweeting the Obama Administration had tapped his phones during the election. Trump is so unhinged, it's frightening. He is so naive to the concrete, unscripted reality show he's actually immersed in, it's almost bizarre. His weekend forays to Mar-A-Lago is evidence he can't handle it, this reality where he does not run things, where he is going to be held to a standard he is clueless even exists. Trump not releasing his taxes is more evidence of this frightening aspect of his unhinged reality. Every president before Trump has released their tax returns and we must now force him to do the same. His refusal to is evidence of concealment. He's hiding something that will unseat him or he'd comply with the overwhelming call for him to do so, a call coming from both side of the aisle. And his proximity to a nuclear arsenal sends shivers through me when I think about what could happen if he ever felt squeezed to have to do something that just may take him down.

Status quo on Korean Peninsula will NOT hold through another generation. Kim Jong Un is almost certainly the last of his kind. This will be resolved one way or another.

Peace does have a way of surprising the world sometimes, and I hope that will be the case.

The U.S. cannot afford to underestimate how important the NK conflict has been for China for the past 50 years. It's their big bargaining chip in international affairs. But now, 2017, China can stand on its own, and it CAN afford to experiment with a new type of North Korea, or even a unified Korea. The only way the US resolves the issue on the Korean Peninsula PEACEFULLY is by acknowledging new parameters for China's emergent power in the Pacific. As yucky as it will taste, we might need to back off on the territorial issues in the South Pacific and Taiwan. We might need to let China be China (and hope that they're not interested in making South America and Oceania part of China, too...).
N.Korea can make N-weapons. Wonder if they know how to make the vehicles or even the tires they ride on. Any good news from N.Korea lately?
I can't trust a supposed "deal" from a Trump Administration.
Maybe he's planning to us this as his excuse to scoot to West Palm every weekend.
Great, as long as you disregard North Korea's massive anti-aircraft defenses. Old? Sure. A bit rusty? You bet. Not worth risking it for a load of beef jerky? Definitely!
Peace treaties, good. Missiles bad. Peace treaties don't work. Missiles do. What a strange world...

The presidency is no place for 'on the job learning'. The American people will come to regret not electing the most qualified person ever to run for the presidency (hint: her name is Hillary Clinton). But, but, her emails...
Still with Her, huh?

"U.S. Can’t Effectively Counter Nuclear Threat, Times Finds"

I'm so glad we have the smartest Commander-In-Chief that there has ever been to tackle this problem. Only he can solve our many and mounting problems. He knows so much more than anyone else, including the generals, and will figure it out soon enough. After all, that's why our well-informed and thoughtful national neighbors elected him in huge numbers. It's a movement, the likes of which "they've never seen before".

Thank God for His chosen one.

Donald Trump proudly states that he can't use a computer. Does this mean that he will draft one of his kids to become a cyber-warrior?

https://thetruthoncommonsense.com
Wow, Mr Reader, that is really on-topic!,

The only party with influence over Kim is China.  China needs to know that any NK missile fired at America will trigger a hailstorm of US nukes on Chinese cities.  There's a message that fits on a tweet.
Perhaps it takes a mad man to stop a mad man, because both of them know that collateral damage is not in their calculation. Rest of us can just pray.
